Comments_List: I learned how techniques in biostatistics could potentially be utilized in my research of astrostatistics.

This class both failed to teach me new statistical techniques instead choosing to focus more on the results of previous bio papers and applications of these techniques in bio but failed to achieve any degree of depth to make this knowledge useful
I learned a lot of new things I had never thought about before coming from less experience with Biology.
It helps give practical insights into how statistics is commonly applied in biology. Perhaps it could include more real data rather than mostly simulated data.

The lectures themselves served nearly no purpose. Actually teaching us statistics would be a worthwhile addition. The homework assignments were mostly tedious but they did have a few interesting and challenging questions
Yes, if the student is looking to get more practice using already-known statistical methods.

No, I don't see any reason to take this course regardless of what you hope to learn or your background. The majority of the students were simply taking it to fulfill their biostats requirements which was clear by the general lack of motivation and interest
I would recommend this course to another student because it was very interesting and well planned out.
